author: adamdriscoll
body:
Adds "ProgressCharacter" to the ProgressRecord class and a "ProgressCharacter" parameter to the Write-Progress cmdlet. 

This addresses: #2488

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1256531/22614460/dca112dc-ea47-11e6-92cc-93a10aa9bcd7.png)

comments.author: adamdriscoll
comments.body: This PR does not include tests. I'm actually not quite sure how to test this appropriately and would be happy to add some tests with some direction.

comments.author: adamdriscoll
comments.body: The only issue with this PR is that it really doesn't fix the fact that binary cmdlets could write progress with a different character. If that's something required by the original issue, we probably just want to close this PR and figure out a different solution.

comments.author: iSazonov
powercode
comments.body: But does this really belong to the progress record? Isn't that something that should be on the host responsible for rendering the progress?

comments.author: adamdriscoll
comments.body: @powercode I kind of thought that was well after implementing this. The ProgressNode (extends from ProgressRecord) that actually does the rendering of the progress has access to the PSHostRawUserInterface for the host. We could add a property onto there to adjust the character as well.

comments.author: lzybkr
comments.body: You will need to test this change with remoting between versions of PowerShell - the type is known to remoting and older versions of PowerShell may not handle the new property.

comments.author: adamdriscoll
comments.body: @lzybkr Noted. What's your thought on how this is implemented? Think it should be more of a host thing and not on the ProgressRecord itself?

comments.author: lzybkr
comments.body: It does seem like a host thing - e.g. a graphical host wouldn't use a character.

comments.author: adamdriscoll
comments.body: I'm gonna close this and look at implementing it differently.

title: Adding ProgressCharacter to Write-Progress and ProgressRecord.
